TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMethodReturnMessage implements class System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage, class System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodMessage

Docs.summary: Defines the method call return message interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A method call return message represents the response to a method call on an object at the end of the message sink. An IMethodReturnMessage is generated as a result of a method called on a remote object, and is used to return the results of the method call back to the caller.
## Examples The following example code shows a custom proxy that overrides `RealProxy.Invoke` in order to write the return message information to the console.
[!code-cpp[IMethodReturnMessage_ReturnValue#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.runtime.remotin_64_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[IMethodReturnMessage_ReturnValue#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.runtime.remotin_64_1.vb)] [!code-cs[IMethodReturnMessage_ReturnValue#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.runtime.remotin_64_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets the exception thrown during the method call.
Docs.value: The exception object for the method call, or if the method did not throw an exception.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example code shows a custom proxy that overrides RealProxy.Invoke in order to write the return message information, including whether the method threw an exception.
[!code-cpp[IMethodReturnMessage_Exception#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.runtime.remotin_88_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[IMethodReturnMessage_Exception#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.runtime.remotin_88_1.vb)] [!code-cs[IMethodReturnMessage_Exception#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.runtime.remotin_88_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The immediate caller makes the call through a reference to the interface and does not have infrastructure permission.
Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example code shows a custom proxy that overrides `RealProxy.Invoke` in order to write the return message information to the console.
[!code-cpp[IMethodReturnMessage_ReturnValue#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.runtime.remotin_55_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[IMethodReturnMessage_ReturnValue#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.runtime.remotin_55_1.vb)] [!code-cs[IMethodReturnMessage_ReturnValue#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.runtime.remotin_55_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Returns the specified argument marked as a or an parameter.
Docs.value: The specified argument marked as a or an parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the OutArgs property is redundant since the same functionality can be achieved through the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodReturnMessage.OutArgCount%2A> field and <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodReturnMessage.GetOutArg%2A> method, there might be performance optimization available if the implementer understands when all the arguments will be retrieved.
> [!WARNING] > If <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodReturnMessage.Exception%2A> is not `null`, a <xref:System.IndexOutOfRangeException?displayProperty=fullName> exception is thrown when OutArgs is accessed.
